perturbation.original_text: b. Agent shall be reimbursed for expenses as contemplated by Section 8 of this Agreement, regardless of whether the Offering is successfully completed. Any out-of-pocket expenses or commissions payable under this Agreement shall be paid in next day funds on the earlier of the initial Closing Date or a determination by the Company to terminate or abandon the Offering, and on each subsequent Closing Date thereafter.
perturbation.changed_text: b. Agent shall be reimbursed for expenses as contemplated by Section 8 of this Agreement, regardless of whether the Offering is successfully completed. Any out-of-pocket expenses or commissions payable under this Agreement shall be paid within 30 days of invoice submission, only if the offering is successfully completed. If the offering is terminated or abandoned, reimbursement will be at the sole discretion of the Company.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding when and under what conditions the Agent is reimbursed for expenses. The original text states reimbursement regardless of the offering's success, payable in next day funds. The revised text introduces a 30-day payment term contingent on successful completion and discretionary reimbursement upon termination, creating uncertainty and potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 8. Payment of Expenses. The Company covenants and agrees with the Agent that it will pay or cause to be paid the following: (i) the fees, disbursements and expenses of counsel to the Company and accountants in connection with the registration of the Shares under the Act and all other expenses in connection with the preparation, printing and filing of the Registration Statement, each Preliminary Prospectus, the Prospectus, each Permitted Free Writing Prospectus and any amendments or supplements thereto, and the mailing and delivering of copies thereof to the Agent and dealers; (ii) the cost of printing or reproducing this agreement, the Blue Sky Survey, any dealer agreements and any other documents in connection with the offering, purchase, sale and delivery of the Shares; (iii) all expenses in connection with the qualification of the Shares for offering and sale under state securities laws; (iv) the cost of preparing stock certificates; (v) all expenses related to road shows; (vi) the costs or expenses of any transfer agent or registrar; and (vi) all reasonable out-of-pocket fees and expenses of the Agent, including the reasonable fees and expenses of counsel for the Agent related to the Offering and not otherwise specifically provided for in this Section; the total for all such reasonable out-of-pocket fees and expenses shall not exceed $5,000 without the consent of the Company (exclusive of any blue sky-related fees if the Agent's counsel is requested to complete such services by the Company).
perturbation.changed_text: 8. Payment of Expenses. The Company covenants and agrees with the Agent that it will pay or cause to be paid the following: (i) the fees, disbursements and expenses of counsel to the Company and accountants in connection with the registration of the Shares under the Act and all other expenses in connection with the preparation, printing and filing of the Registration Statement, each Preliminary Prospectus, the Prospectus, each Permitted Free Writing Prospectus and any amendments or supplements thereto, and the mailing and delivering of copies thereof to the Agent and dealers; (ii) the cost of printing or reproducing this agreement, the Blue Sky Survey, any dealer agreements and any other documents in connection with the offering, purchase, sale and delivery of the Shares; (iii) all expenses in connection with the qualification of the Shares for offering and sale under state securities laws; (iv) the cost of preparing stock certificates; (v) all expenses related to road shows; (vi) the costs or expenses of any transfer agent or registrar; and (vi) all reasonable out-of-pocket fees and expenses of the Agent, including the reasonable fees and expenses of counsel for the Agent related to the Offering and not otherwise specifically provided for in this Section; the total for all such reasonable out-of-pocket fees and expenses shall not exceed $5,000 without the consent of the Company (exclusive of any blue sky-related fees if the Agent's counsel is requested to complete such services by the Company). However, the Company is not responsible for any expenses exceeding $2,500 if the offering does not reach at least 75% of its targeted amount.
perturbation.explanation: The original text sets a limit of $5,000 on reimbursable agent expenses. The addition introduces a lower threshold of $2,500 if the offering doesn't meet a certain target. This creates an in-text contradiction on total expenses, making uncertain how the expenses will be accounted for if the raised capital does not meet the 75% threshold.

perturbation.original_text: 13. Termination and Payment of Expenses. This Agreement shall become effective on the date hereof and shall terminate upon the termination of the Offering. If for any reason any Shares are not delivered by or on behalf of the Company as provided herein, the Company will reimburse the Agent for all actual and accountable out-of-pocket expenses, including fees and disbursements of counsel, reasonably incurred by the Agent in making preparations for the purchase, sale and delivery of the Shares not so delivered, but the Company shall then be under no further liability to the Agent except as provided in Section 8 and Section 10 hereof.
perturbation.changed_text: 13. Termination and Payment of Expenses. This Agreement shall become effective on the date hereof and shall terminate upon the termination of the Offering, except in cases of gross negligence by the agent. If for any reason any Shares are not delivered by or on behalf of the Company as provided herein, the Company will reimburse the Agent for a maximum of 50% of all actual and accountable out-of-pocket expenses, including fees and disbursements of counsel, reasonably incurred by the Agent in making preparations for the purchase, sale and delivery of the Shares not so delivered, but the Company shall then be under no further liability to the Agent except as provided in Section 8 and Section 10 hereof.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that in the event any Shares are not delivered, the Agent is reimbursed for all actual out-of-pocket expenses. The addition limits this reimbursement to a maximum of 50% of those expenses, thus creating a contradictory statement about how much expenses will be reimbursed, causing uncertainty and risk for the agent.
